page.title: 12TRANSPORT AROUND CRICK
page.content: There are several means of transport available to people in our area.The main two are the motorway and railway. There is also a canal.Footpaths and bridle paths also criss-cross the area. {Motorway.}The first motorway built in the early 1950's crosses this area: M1.The motorway has six lanes; 3 going south to London 70 miles away and 3 going north to Leeds. Bicycles, tractors,pedestrians and mopeds are not allowed on the M1 but cars, lorries and buses are.Motorbikes over 50 c.c. are permitted except learners. There is a motorway junction at Crick where vehicles may join or leave. It is Junction 18.The lanes carry traffic at diffferent speeds-fast,intermediate and slow. The maximum speed is 70 mph. Unfortunately there are often road works causing traffic delays
